name: Health:lga_profilesdata2011
title: Local Government Area (LGA) profiles data 2011

legal.licenceType: Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Australia (CC BY 3.0 AU)

keyword: community profile, health, well being, quality of life, demographic, population, employment, social,Victoria,Department of Health and Human Services
abstract: The Local Government Area (LGA) profiles are produced annually to facilitate service planning and policy development by enabling access to a broad range of data about each LGA. Each profile includes population, socio-economic, services and health data relating to the LGA, provided by a range of sources.

selectedAttributes.name: lga_code
selectedAttributes.title: Local Government Area Code
selectedAttributes.description: Code of the local government area

selectedAttributes.name: perc_at_risk_alcohol
selectedAttributes.title: % at risk of short term harm from alcohol
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of residents of the LGA who indicated as part of the Victorian Population Health Survey that they consume alcohol at risky or high risk levels at least once per week.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_children_vulnerable_one
selectedAttributes.title: % children developmentally vulnerable in one or more domains
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of children who are vulnerable across one or more of the five domains of early childhood development as measured using the Australian Early Development Index.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_children_vulnerable_two
selectedAttributes.title: % children developmentally vulnerable in one or more domains
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of children who are vulnerable across two or more of the five domains of early childhood development as measured using the Australian Early Development Index.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_female_75_alone
selectedAttributes.title: % female 75+ living alone
selectedAttributes.description: The female proportion of the LGA population who are aged 75 and over who live in a single person household.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_female_low_income
selectedAttributes.title: % female low income
selectedAttributes.description: The female proportion of the population aged 15 and over with a gross individual income of less than $400 per week.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_females_18_smokers
selectedAttributes.title: % females 18+ that are current smokers
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of females aged 18 years or older who indicated that they are current smokers that is they smoke daily or occasionally.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_females_not_fruitveg
selectedAttributes.title: % females that did not meet fruit and vegetable guidelines
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of females who indicate that they do not meet the current Australian guidelines for fruit and vegetable consumption.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_females_not_physical
selectedAttributes.title: % females who did not meet physical activity guidelines
selectedAttributes.description: The proportion of females who do not meet the National Physical Activity Guidelines for Australians developed by the Department of Health and Aged Care 1999.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_inpatient_private_hospital
selectedAttributes.title: % inpatient separations in private hospital
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of total separations for residents of the LGA which are in a private hospital.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_low_english
selectedAttributes.title: % low English proficiency
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of the population who indicated in the 2006 census that they spoke English ?not well? or ?not at all?.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_male_75_alone
selectedAttributes.title: % male 75+ living alone
selectedAttributes.description: The male proportion of the LGA population who are aged 75 and over who live in a single person household.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_male_low_income
selectedAttributes.title: % male low income
selectedAttributes.description: The male proportion of the population aged 15 and over with a gross individual income of less than $400 per week.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_males_18_smokers
selectedAttributes.title: % males 18+ that are current smokers
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of males aged 18 years or older who indicated that they are current smokers that is they smoke daily or occasionally.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_males_not_fruitveg
selectedAttributes.title: % males that did not meet fruit and vegetable guidelines
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of males who indicate that they do not meet the current Australian guidelines for fruit and vegetable consumption.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_males_not_physical
selectedAttributes.title: % males who did not meet physical activity guidelines
selectedAttributes.description: The proportion of males who do not meet the National Physical Activity Guidelines for Australians developed by the Department of Health and Aged Care 1999.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_households
selectedAttributes.title: % of households with income <$650 per week
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of households with a gross total income of less than $650 per week. Only incomes of household members aged 15 years and over are included in the household total.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_households_income_650
selectedAttributes.title: % of households with income <$650 per week
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of households with a gross total income of less than $650 per week. Only incomes of household members aged 15 years and over are included in the household total.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_persons_75_alone
selectedAttributes.title: % of persons aged 75+ who live alone
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of the LGA population who are aged 75 and over who live in a single person household.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_individual_income
selectedAttributes.title: % of persons with individual income <$400 per week
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of the population aged 15 and over with a gross individual income of less than $400 per week and the proportion of these who are female/male.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_volunteers
selectedAttributes.title: % of population which volunteers
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of the population aged 15 or over who indicated that they did voluntary work through an organisation or group in the twelve months prior to the 2006 Census.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_pop_not_complete_year_12
selectedAttributes.title: % of population who did not complete year 12
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of people aged 15 years and over who did not attend school or attended school but did not complete year 12.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_pop_higher_education
selectedAttributes.title: % of population with higher education qualification
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of people aged 15 years and over who have attained a definitive higher education qualification including a post-graduate degree- a graduate diploma a graduate certificate or a bachelor degree.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_membership_groups
selectedAttributes.title: % of population with membership of organised groups
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of the population who say they are a member of an organised group such as a sports or church group or another community organisation or professional organisation.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_people_18_smokers
selectedAttributes.title: % people 18+ that are current smokers
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of persons/males/females aged 18 years or older who indicate that they are current smokers that is they smoke daily or occasionally.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_persons_reporting_type_2_diabetes
selectedAttributes.title: % persons reporting type 2 diabetes
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of persons who reported that they had been told by a doctor that they had type 2 diabetes.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_persons_not_fruitveg
selectedAttributes.title: % persons that did not meet fruit and vegetable guidelines
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of persons who indicate that they do not meet the current Australian guidelines for fruit and vegetable consumption.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_persons_not_physical
selectedAttributes.title: % persons who did not meet physical activity guidelines
selectedAttributes.description: The proportion of people who do not meet the National Physical Activity Guidelines for Australians developed by the Department of Health and Aged Care 1999.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_population_food_insecurity
selectedAttributes.title: % population with food insecurity
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of people who ran out of food in the last twelve months and could not afford to buy more.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_private_health
selectedAttributes.title: % population with private health insurance
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of the LGA population aged 15 years and over covered by private health insurance.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_students_government_school
selectedAttributes.title: % students attending a government school
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of all primary and secondary school students resident in the LGA who attend a government school (rather than an independent or Catholic school).

selectedAttributes.name: perc_core_activities
selectedAttributes.title: % with need for assistance with core activities
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of people in the LGA who need ?help or assistance in one or more of the three core activity areas of self-care mobility and communication because of a long-term health condition-  a disability or old age.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_9_students_min_numeracy
selectedAttributes.title: % year 9 students who attain national minimum standards in numeracy
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of year 9 students who achieved at or above the national minimum standards in numeracy in the National Assessment Program ? Literacy and Numeracy (NAPLAN).

selectedAttributes.name: perc_9_students_min_reading
selectedAttributes.title: % year 9 students who attain national minimum standards in reading
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of year 9 students who achieved at or above the national minimum standards in reading in the National Assessment Program ? Literacy and Numeracy (NAPLAN).

selectedAttributes.name: perc_9_students_min_writing
selectedAttributes.title: % year 9 students who attain national minimum standards in writing
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of year 9 students who achieved at or above the national minimum standards in writing in the National Assessment Program ? Literacy and Numeracy (NAPLAN).

selectedAttributes.name: perc_atsi_population
selectedAttributes.title: %ATSI population
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of the population who are identified as being Aboriginal or Torres Straits Islander in the Experimental Estimates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander produced by the ABS.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_born_overseas
selectedAttributes.title: %Born overseas
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of the population who were born overseas.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_business
selectedAttributes.title: %Business
selectedAttributes.description: The proportion of the LGAs total area assigned to business land use.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_humanitarian
selectedAttributes.title: %Humanitarian arrivals
selectedAttributes.description: The number of individuals arriving from overseas under the permanent resident visa category of humanitarian.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_industrial
selectedAttributes.title: %Industrial
selectedAttributes.description: The proportion of the LGAs total area assigned to industrial land use.

selectedAttributes.name: percpopulation_near_pt
selectedAttributes.title: %population near public transport
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of the population that lives within 400 metres of a bus and/or tram stop and/or 800 metres of a train station.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_residential
selectedAttributes.title: %Residential
selectedAttributes.description: The proportion of the LGAs total area assigned to residential land use.

selectedAttributes.name: perc_rural
selectedAttributes.title: %Rural
selectedAttributes.description: The proportion of the LGAs total area assigned to rural land use.

selectedAttributes.name: aged_high_care
selectedAttributes.title: Aged care (high care) places per 1000 eligible population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of residential aged care places licensed to provide services to residents with high levels of dependency per 1000 target population.

selectedAttributes.name: aged_low_care
selectedAttributes.title: Aged care (low care) places per 1000 eligible population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of aged care places licensed to provide services to residents with low levels of dependency per 1000 target population.

selectedAttributes.name: average_average_stay_all
selectedAttributes.title: Average length of stay (days) all hospitals
selectedAttributes.description: The average length of stay (in days) for all inpatients. Note that all separations (including same-day stays) have been included.

selectedAttributes.name: average_stay_public
selectedAttributes.title: Average length of stay (days) public hospitals
selectedAttributes.description: The average length of stay (in days) for a Victorian public hospital inpatient. Note that all separations (including same-day stays) have been included.

selectedAttributes.name: cancer_incidence_females
selectedAttributes.title: Cancer incidence - females per 100000
selectedAttributes.description: The total number of malignant cancers newly diagnosed in 2010 for females. Presented as a rate per 100000.

selectedAttributes.name: cancer_incidence_males
selectedAttributes.title: Cancer incidence - males per 100000
selectedAttributes.description: The total number of malignant cancers newly diagnosed in 2010 for males. Presented as a rate per 100000.

selectedAttributes.name: cancer_incidence
selectedAttributes.title: Cancer incidence per 100000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The total number of malignant cancers newly diagnosed in 2010 for total persons. Presented as a rate per 100000.

selectedAttributes.name: drug_and_alcohol
selectedAttributes.title: Drug and alcohol clients per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of residents of an LGA per 1000 population who received treatment from alcohol and drug treatment services.

selectedAttributes.name: ed_presentations
selectedAttributes.title: ED presentations per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of presentations by residents of an LGA at public hospital emergency departments per 1000 population.

selectedAttributes.name: family_incidents
selectedAttributes.title: Family incidents per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of family violence incidents reported to police per 1000 population. Incidents are not necessarily offences typically only about 25% of incidents result in a formal charge.

selectedAttributes.name: female_life_expectancy
selectedAttributes.title: Female life expectancy
selectedAttributes.description: The average number of years a female of a given age is expected to live if current mortality rates continue to apply.

selectedAttributes.name: fte_students
selectedAttributes.title: FTE students
selectedAttributes.description: The number of full-time equivalent students enrolled in schools which are located within the LGA.

selectedAttributes.name: gp_attendances_females_males
selectedAttributes.title: GP attendances females per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The rate of attendances at a General Practitioner for females per 1000 population for services under the Medicare Benefits Schedule and Department of Veterans Affairs.

selectedAttributes.name: gp_attendances_males
selectedAttributes.title: GP attendances males per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The rate of attendances at a General Practitioner for males per 1000 population for services under the Medicare Benefits Schedule and Department of Veterans Affairs.

selectedAttributes.name: gp_attendances_total
selectedAttributes.title: GP attendances total per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The rate of attendances at a General Practitioner per 1000 population for services under the Medicare Benefits Schedule and Department of Veterans Affairs.

selectedAttributes.name: hacc_clients_69
selectedAttributes.title: HACC clients  aged 0-69 per 1000 target population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of people aged 0-69 years receiving services funded by the Home and Community Care (HACC) program per 1000 target population.

selectedAttributes.name: hacc_clients_70
selectedAttributes.title: HACC clients aged 70 plus per 1000 target population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of people aged 70 years and over receiving services funded by the Home and Community Care (HACC) program per 1000 target population.

selectedAttributes.name: inpatient_separations
selectedAttributes.title: Inpatient separations per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of hospital inpatient separations per 1000 population. A separation is a completed admission to hospital.

selectedAttributes.name: irsed
selectedAttributes.title: IRSED
selectedAttributes.description: A measure of relative socio-economic disadvantage in a given geographic area.

selectedAttributes.name: lga_name
selectedAttributes.title: Local Government Area Name
selectedAttributes.description: Name of the local government area

selectedAttributes.name: lga
selectedAttributes.title: Local Government Area Name
selectedAttributes.description: Name of the local government area

selectedAttributes.name: male_life_expectancy
selectedAttributes.title: Male life expectancy
selectedAttributes.description: The average number of years a male of a given age is expected to live if current mortality rates continue to apply.

selectedAttributes.name: metro_rural
selectedAttributes.title: Metro/rural
selectedAttributes.description: This item specifies whether the local government area (LGA) is in a metropolitan or rural departmental region.

selectedAttributes.name: new_settler
selectedAttributes.title: New settler arrivals per 100000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of arrivals from overseas per 100000 population during the 2010?11 financial year under the permanent resident visa category.

selectedAttributes.name: number_of_hospitals_health
selectedAttributes.title: Number of hospitals/health services
selectedAttributes.description: The number of hospitals and health service campuses located within the LGA. Includes both public and private hospitals.

selectedAttributes.name: number_of_schools
selectedAttributes.title: Number of schools
selectedAttributes.description: The number of schools located in the LGA. This item includes government private and Catholic primary and secondary schools. It also includes schools for children with special needs.

selectedAttributes.name: pharmacies
selectedAttributes.title: Pharmacies per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of retail pharmacies per 1000 population located within the LGA.

selectedAttributes.name: primary_care_ed
selectedAttributes.title: Primary care type ED presentations per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The proportion of presentations at Emergency Departments within the LGA which were classified as ?primary care type presentations?.

selectedAttributes.name: primary_health_occasions
selectedAttributes.title: Primary health occasions of service per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of occasions of service per 1000 population provided by primary health services to residents of the LGA.

selectedAttributes.name: separations_attended_hospital
selectedAttributes.title: Separations from most frequently attended hospital
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of all separations involving residents of an LGA which occurred at the most frequently attended public hospital. Estimated Resident Population 2010.

selectedAttributes.name: unemployment_rate
selectedAttributes.title: Unemployment rate
selectedAttributes.description: The percentage of the labour force which is unemployed.

selectedAttributes.name: registered_mental_health
selectedAttributes.title: Registered mental health clients per 1000 population
selectedAttributes.description: The number of residents of an LGA who are registered as clients with a mental health service per 1000 population.

selectedAttributes.name: erp_2010__males_total
selectedAttributes.title: ERP 2010  Males Total
selectedAttributes.description: The number of males in the LGA in 2010.

selectedAttributes.name: erp_2010__females_total
selectedAttributes.title: ERP 2010  Females Total
selectedAttributes.description: The number of females in the LGA in 2010.
